data.title: Cherokee County Kansas
data.meta_description: Joplin Globe Obituaries Monday, 05/12/2008 (10 + 02 = 12 total results) Parrish, Jack L. (July 29, 1917 - May 09, 2008) Stephens, Mary Lucile Wehr (Fe
data.text:
Arthur A. Bruce Jr., 81, passed away at 3:55 p.m. Monday, May 12, 2008, at St. John's Hospital in Joplin. Mr. Bruce was born on Jan. 8, 1927, in Milford, Kan., he was the son of Arthur A Bruce Sr. and Nellie Irene Bruce. He moved as a small child with his parents to a farm in the Ozarks, north of Mountain Grove, Mo. A graduate of Mountain Grove High School, he worked part time during his high school years in a local funeral home. He was a veteran of World War II, serving with the U.S. Army Medical Corp. Mr. Bruce graduated from the College of Mortuary Science in St. Louis, Mo., in 1947, and was a licensed embalmer and funeral director. He formerly owned funeral homes in Natchez, Miss., Lamar, Mo., and in Poplar Bluff, Mo. Prior to his retirement on May 1, 1990, he owned and operated the Ulmer Funeral Home in Carthage. Mr. Bruce purchased the Ulmer Funeral Home in May 1978, from Grace Ulmer Hill. On Sept. 28, 1986, they dedicated the addition of the new chapel that Mr. Bruce designed. He was a member of the First Baptist Church, of Carthage, where he served as a deacon and through the years, served on various committees and as chairman of both the Building Committee of the Family Life Center and the addition to the First Baptist Church Chapel. He was active in the Carthage Chamber of Commerce, the Carthage Kiwanis Club and served on the Carthage Industrial Development Board. Mr. Bruce was also a member of Missouri Funeral Directors Association and the National Funeral Directors Association. On Jan. 15, 1955, at the First Baptist Church, Little Rock, Ark., he was united in marriage to Mary Ann McDaniel. She survives. Also surviving is one son, Arthur A. Bruce III and his wife, Elizabeth Jan and their son, Eric, of Colorado Springs, Colo.; two daughters, Cynthia Ann Cooperman and her husband, Michael and their two sons, Aaron and Colin, of Franklin, Tenn., and Melissa Ann Bryan and her husband Emory and their four daughters, Rebecca, Kelly, Laura and Emily, of Tulsa,Okla.; one brother, Paul C. Bruce, Ballwin, Mo.; and two sisters, Dorothy Holbert, Ellisville, Mo., and Irene Hall, of Sullivan, Mo. His parents, two sisters and one brother preceded him in death. Services will be 10 a.m. Friday, May 16, at the Ulmer Funeral Home Chapel. Burial will be in Park Cemetery, Carthage. There will be open visitation. Contributions may be made to McCune Brooks Home Healthcare or St. John's Home Health in care of the Ulmer Funeral Home. Arrangements are under the direction of the Ulmer Funeral Home.

Richard L. "Rick" Rountree, age 52, Joplin, passed away on Saturday, May 10, 2008. Rick was born Jan. 22, 1956, in Joplin, and graduated in 1974 from Parkwood High School. He worked for Joplin Supply in sales since 1982. He was a member, and an interim worship leader at Forest Park Baptist Church and was a member of the Christian Motorcycle Association of Joplin. Rick's love of singing for the Lord brought him great joy and he was honored to serve as interim Music Director at Forest park Baptist Church in Joplin for the past 15 months. Rick was a deacon at his church and a member of a gospel music quartet. When he shared his love for God with his musical solo messages it was always a comfort and uplifting for the listeners. Rick is survived by a daughter, Kali Rountree and her fiance, Jason Brown, of Joplin; his father, Jim Rountree, of San Antonio, Texas; his mother, Betty Rountree, of Joplin; sister, Belinda Whitehead and husband, Michael, of Lee's Summit, Mo.; nephew, Chris Whitehead; half brothers, James M. Rountree and wife, Jennifer, of Jerral, Texas, and Jay M. Rountree, of San Antonio; and half sister, Julie M. Louden and husband, Brian, of San Antonio.

Kathy Gail Rountree, age 47, was born Dec. 29, 1960, in Joplin, and was a lifelong resident of the Joplin area and graduated in 1979, from Seneca High School. She was a graphic arts teacher at Franklin Technical School since 1995, and was a member of Forest Park Baptist Church. She was a loving and caring daughter and daughter-in-law to her mother and Rick's mother; always seeing a need we might have for her to address. Kathy loved the arts and cared deeply about the accomplishments of her students at Franklin Tech. Kathy wore many hats at Forest Park Baptist Church, always staying out of the lime light, but putting her God given talents to work in any way that was needed. She was preceded in death by her father, George Bilke. Survivors include her daughter, Kali Rountree and her fiance, Jason Brown, of Joplin; brother, Larry Bilke and wife, Mary Kay Bilke; nephews, Zac Bilke and wife, Felecia and Nathan Bilke and wife, Keri, all of Joplin.

Clayton B. Rountree, age 13, Joplin, was born Feb. 27, 1995, in Joplin, and was a seventh grade student at Memorial Middle School. He was on the Stingray swim team, of Joplin, and was recognized and presented with a certificate for the Joplin Academic All Stars for the past six years. One of his special traits was his compassion and caring for his peers, as well as his family. Clay sang in the choir at church and participated in special programs there. Clay is survived by a sister, Kali Rountree and fiance, Jason Brown; grandparents, Jim Rountree, of San Antonio, and Betty Rountree, of Joplin; aunts and uncles, Mary Kay and Larry Bilke, of Joplin, and Belinda and Michael Whitehead, of Lee's Summit. Funeral services will be Friday, May 16, at 2 p.m. at Forest Park Baptist Church with Dr. John Swadley and Rev. Johnny Wilkins officiating. Interment will follow in Hornet Cemetery. The family will receive friends at Forest Park Baptist Church on Thursday from 6 to 8 p.m. Memorial contributions may be made to the Rountree Memorial Fund in care of United Missouri Bank, 2300 E. 7th Street, Joplin, Mo., 64801. Online condolences may be made at parkermortuary.com Has individual obituaries now.

Rick Rountree

(Born January 22, 1956 - Died May 10, 2008)

Richard L. "Rick" Rountree, age 52, Joplin, passed away on Saturday, May 10, 2008. Rick was born January 22, 1956 in Joplin, and graduated in 1974 from Parkwood High School. He worked for Joplin Supply in sales since 1982. He was a member, and an interim worship leader at Forest Park Baptist Church, and was a member of the Christian Motorcycle Association of Joplin. Rick's love of singing for the Lord brought him great joy, and he was honored to serve as interim Music Director at Forest park Baptist Church in Joplin for the past 15 months. Rick was a Deacon at his church, and a member of a gospel music quartet. When he shared his love for God with his musical solo messages it was always a comfort and uplifting for the listeners.

Rick is survived by a daughter, Kali Rountree and her fiance' Jason Brown of Joplin; his father, Jim Rountree of San Antonio, Texas, his mother, Betty Rountree of Joplin; sister, Belinda Whitehead and husband Michael of Lee's Summit, Missouri; nephew, Chris Whitehead; half brothers, James M. Rountree and wife Jennifer of Jerral, Texas, and Jay M. Rountree of San Antonio; half sister, Julie M. Louden and husband Brian of San Antonio. Funeral services will be Friday, May 16, 2008 at 2:00 p.m. at Forest Park Baptist Church with Dr. John Swadley and Rev. Johnny Wilkins officiating. Interment will follow in Hornet Cemetery. The family will receive friends at Forest Park Baptist Church on Thursday from 6:00 to 8:00 p.m.

Memorial contributions are requested to the Rountree Memorial Fund c/o United Missouri Bank.

Kathy Rountree

(Born December 29, 1960 - Died May 10, 2008)

Kathy Gail Rountree, age 47, was born December 29, 1960 in Joplin, and was a lifelong resident of the Joplin area, and graduated in 1979 from Seneca High School. She was a Graphic Arts Teacher at Franklin Technical School since 1995, and was a member of Forest Park Baptist Church. She was a loving and caring daughter and daughter-in-law to her mother and Rick's mother; always seeing a need we might have for her to address. Kathy loved the Arts and cared deeply about the accomplishments of her students at Franklin Tech. Kathy wore many hats at Forest Park Baptist Church, always staying out of the lime light, but putting her God given talents to work in any way that was needed.

She was preceded in death by her father, George Bilke.

Survivors include her daughter, Kali Rountree and her fiance' Jason Brown of Joplin; brother, Larry Bilke and wife Mary Kay Bilke; nephews, Zac Bilke and wife Felecia, and Nathan Bilke and wife Keri all of Joplin.

Funeral services will be Friday, May 16, 2008 at 2:00 p.m. at Forest Park Baptist Church with Dr. John Swadley and Rev. Johnny Wilkins officiating. Interment will follow in Hornet Cemetery. The family will receive friends at Forest Park Baptist Church on Thursday from 6:00 to 8:00 p.m.

Memorial contributions are requested to the Rountree Memorial Fund c/o United Missouri Bank.

Clayton Rountree

(Born February 27, 1995 - Died May 10, 2008)

Clayton B. Rountree, age 13, Joplin, was born February 27, 1995 in Joplin, and was a seventh grade student at Memorial Middle School. He was on the Stingray swim team of Joplin, and was recognized and presented with a certificate for the Joplin Academic All Stars for the past 6 years. One of his special traits was his compassion and caring for his peers, as well as his family. Clay sang in the choir at church, and participated in special programs there.

Clay is survived by a sister, Kali Rountree and fianc√© Jason Brown; grandparents, Jim Rountree of San Antonio, and Betty Rountree of Joplin; aunts and uncles, Mary Kay and Larry Bilke of Joplin, Belinda and Michael Whitehead of Lee's Summit, Missouri.

Funeral services will be Friday, May 16, 2008 at 2:00 p.m. at Forest Park Baptist Church with Dr. John Swadley and Rev. Johnny Wilkins officiating. Interment will follow in Hornet Cemetery. The family will receive friends at Forest Park Baptist Church on Thursday from 6:00 to 8:00 p.m.

Memorial contributions are requested to the Rountree Memorial Fund c/o United Missouri Bank.

Note: Family includes Bilke, Ruby M.

Alice Arlene (Hazen) Aldridge died on Wednesday, May 7, 2008, in Joplin, Mo., after a three year battle to survive COPD and lung cancer. She was born on April 19, 1932, in Kansas City, Kan. Alice lived in the same home, within walking distance of her Father's barbershop, until her marriage at the age of 19. Shortly after Alice's marriage to Bill G. Aldridge on April 22, 1951, she worked at the Kansas City Power and Light Company, but in 1952 left home to join him in Honolulu, Hawaii (then a territory), where she lived for two years. They returned to the states in 1954, and while he was stationed at Andrews AFB near Washington, DC, Alice worked in DC at the National Automobile Dealer's Association. Being always supportive of her husband and his career, she sacrificed hers to support his education. Upon discharge from the USAF in January 1955, Alice and Bill returned to Kansas City, where they lived for two years in the Hazen residence, while she worked at Owens Corning Fiberglas Corporation. In 1957, they purchased a home in Wyandotte County, and she continued to work. After nine years of marriage, she had her first child, Bryan. A year later she had her second child, Cara. With two young toddlers, she again made the sacrifice to her husband's education and career by moving to Cambridge, Mass. Upon their return to Kansas City for only another two years, she was again asked to move. They settled into another home in St. Louis County, where she had her last two children, Richard and Susan. They remained there for the next 17 years, interrupted by a one-year period, while they lived in Lawrence, Kan. During her time in St. Louis County, Alice completed two years of college, specializing in English history and literature, in which she was truly an expert. For most of her life she read an average of three books a week, mostly historical novels, and most dealing with English history. In 1977 Alice again had to uproot her family and move to DC, where she became an employee of the federal government. When they returned to St. Louis County in 1979, it would only be for a few months; and they moved back to Arlington, Va., where she lived from 1980 through 1995, and where she returned to work for the IRS as administrative assistant in the office of chief counsel. Alice retired from the IRS in 1995, and moved to Green Valley, Henderson, Nev., until 2006. After Alice became ill, they sold their home in Nevada and moved to Purcell, Mo., in Southwest Missouri, 70 miles south of where her mother and father had grown up. Alice had contracted cancer in 2005, was treated, and the cancer was in remission. But she had severe COPD and was very limited in her ability to walk. Alice is survived by her husband of 57 years, Bill Aldridge of Purcell; a son, Bryan Aldridge, of Fairfax, Va.; a daughter, Cara Aldridge Young, of Mifflinburg, Pa.; a son, Richard Aldridge, of Fairfax, Va., and a daughter, Susan Aldridge, of Broomfield, Colo. She is also survived by nine grandchildren. Finally, Alice is survived by her most cherished cat, "Gremlin." Alice's ashes will be buried in Sheldon, Mo., where her father, mother, and grandparents are also buried. The gravesite ceremony will be private. A memorial service will be held in Arlington, Va., at a date to be announced. Alice Arlene (Hazen) Aldridge spent her life caring for and giving to others, as a devoted and loyal wife, and as a mother who would do anything for her children. In lieu of flowers, donations should be made to the American Cancer Society.

Mildred Garvin Feerick age 96, Joplin, Mo., died peacefully in her home on May 14, 2008, after a lengthy illness. She was born on Oct. 26, 1911, to Harry and Grace Garvin. When Mildred was five, her mother died and she went to live with her grandparents. She attended Joplin Schools and graduated from Joplin Senior High School in 1930. She later moved to St. Louis, Mo., where she met and married Gene Martin, they lived in Benton, Ill., for several years. Together they raised and showed Miniature Pinchers. She loved her puppies and always had at least one, sometimes more. Gene passed away in 1966. She moved back to St. Louis and worked at Principia Christian Science School for a short time. She then later returned to the Joplin area to be close to her family. In 1971, she married John Feerick; she helped John with his business, Feerick Candy Co. until his retirement. They loved to travel and enjoyed many good years together before he passed away June 7, 1986. She was also preceded in death by her brother, Burl M. Garvin in November 1988; a stepdaughter, Shirley Allen in January 2001; a nephew, Phillip L. Garvin in March 2001; and sister-in-law, Ceola Garvin in April 2008. She is survived by a step-daughter, Lynn Martin Russell, of Mount Vernon, Ind.; a stepdaughter, Delores Feerick, of Joplin; and grand daughters, Suzy Shriver, Sandy Nienhaus and their families from the St. Louiarea; two nephews, Gary M. Garvin and Robert D. Garvin, their families; and many great-nieces and nephews. We appreciate the wonderful people who helped her remain in her home these last years of her life. Thanks so much to Trinity Hospice, Myles, Mildred, Pam and Marci for their loving care. Graveside services will be held at 2 p.m. Friday at Mount Hope Cemetery in Webb City, with Rev. Erin Brown officiating. Visitation will be held at 1 p.m. Friday at Thornhill-Dillon Mortuary. Nephews and great nephews will serve as pall-bearers. In lieu of flowers contributions can be made to a favorite charity in her honor. Arrangements will be under the personal care and direction of Thornhill-Dillon Mortuary, of Joplin.
